2.text: Suffer me a little, and I will shew thee that I have yet words for +God.

3.text: I will fetch my knowledge from afar, and will ascribe righteousness to my Creator.

4.text: For truly my words shall be no falsehood: one perfect in knowledge is with thee.

5.text: Lo, God is mighty, but despiseth not [any]; mighty in strength of understanding:

6.text: He saveth not the wicked alive; but he doeth justice to the afflicted.

7.text: He withdraweth not his eyes from the righteous, but with kings on the throne doth he even set them for ever; and they are exalted.

8.text: And if, bound in fetters, they be held in cords of affliction,

9.text: Then he sheweth them their work, and their transgressions, because they have increased.

10.text: And he openeth their ear to discipline, and commandeth that they return from iniquity.

11.text: If they hearken and serve [him], they shall accomplish their days in prosperity, and their years in pleasures.

12.text: But if they hearken not, they shall pass away by the sword, and expire without knowledge.

13.text: But the godless in heart heap up anger; they cry not when he bindeth them:

14.text: Their soul dieth in youth, and their life is among the unclean.

15.text: But he delivereth the afflicted in his affliction, and openeth their ear in [their] oppression.

16.text: Even so would he have allured thee out of the jaws of distress into a broad place, where there is no straitness; and the supply of thy table [would be] full of fatness.

17.text: But thou art full of the judgments of the wicked: judgment and justice take hold [on thee].

18.text: Because there is wrath, [beware] lest it take thee away through chastisement: then a great ransom could not avail thee.

19.text: Will he esteem thy riches? Not gold, nor all the resources of strength!

20.text: Desire not the night, when peoples are cut off from their place.

21.text: Take heed, turn not to iniquity; for this hast thou chosen rather than affliction.

22.text: Lo, God is exalted in his power: who teacheth as he?

23.text: Who hath appointed him his way? or who hath said, Thou hast wrought unrighteousness?

24.text: Remember that thou magnify his work, which men celebrate.

25.text: All men look at it; man beholdeth [it] afar off.

26.text: Lo, God is great, and we comprehend [him] not, neither can the number of his years be searched out.

27.text: For he draweth up the drops of water: they distil in rain from the vapour which he formeth,

28.text: Which the skies pour down [and] drop upon man abundantly.

29.text: But can any understand the spreadings of the clouds, [or] the crashing of his pavilion?

30.text: Lo, he spreadeth his light around him, and covereth the bottom of the sea.

31.text: For with them he judgeth the peoples; he giveth food in abundance.

32.text: [His] hands he covereth with lightning, and commandeth it where it is to strike.

33.text: His thundering declareth concerning him; the cattle even, concerning its coming.
